channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.13
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.13

item.title: CVE-2023-6476|2024-08-02T12:29:15.485Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204.13
item.description: A flaw was found in CRI-O that involves an experimental annotation leading to a container being unconfined. This may allow a pod to specify and get any amount of memory/cpu, circumventing the kubernetes scheduler and potentially resulting in a denial of service in the node.

item.title: CVE-2024-1725|2024-08-02T12:44:23.885Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204.13
item.description: A flaw was found in the kubevirt-csi component of OpenShift Virtualization's Hosted Control Plane (HCP). This issue could allow an authenticated attacker to gain access to the root HCP worker node's volume by creating a custom Persistent Volume that matches the name of a worker node.

item.title: CVE-2024-1725|2024-08-01T18:48:21.831Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204.13
item.description: A flaw was found in the kubevirt-csi component of OpenShift Virtualization's Hosted Control Plane (HCP). This issue could allow an authenticated attacker to gain access to the root HCP worker node's volume by creating a custom Persistent Volume that matches the name of a worker node.

item.title: CVE-2024-5037|2024-07-17T04:27:37.225Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204.13
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift's Telemeter. If certain conditions are in place, an attacker can use a forged token to bypass the issue ("iss") check during JSON web token (JWT) authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-1725|2024-05-08T01:51:31.044Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204.13
item.description: A flaw was found in the kubevirt-csi component of OpenShift Virtualization's Hosted Control Plane (HCP). This issue could allow an authenticated attacker to gain access to the root HCP worker node's volume by creating a custom Persistent Volume that matches the name of a worker node.

item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift's Telemeter. If certain conditions are in place, an attacker can use a forged token to bypass the issue ("iss") check during JSON web token (JWT) authentication.
